section: Exercise 4.18.5: Counting ways to line up for a family photo.
instructions: A family lines up for a photograph. In each of the following situations, how many ways are there for the family to line up so that the mother is next to at least one of her daughters?
question:
(a)

The family consists of two parents, two daughters and two sons.
answer:
Call the daughters A and B.
The number of ways the family can line up with the mother next to A is 2·5!.
The number of ways the family can line up with the mother next to B is 2·5!.
